channel.title: A general 'fuck'
channel.description:
I'm getting uber confused and stuff with this. I keep getting either EOFException or ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.
So what I'm trying to do here is store all of the different bytes in a file in a pool at the top of a new file, then store the original file's name as DataOutputStream.writeUTF(filename), and then for every byte in the file, write an index pointing to somewhere in the pool containing the byte. I'm having a hell of a time extracting this after I write it.
I'll go ahead and attach what I'm using. Thanks in advance for help. :)
By the way, it only screws up on data files. Text files work fine always.

item.title: A general 'fuck'
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Lol, thanks guys. Fixed both things BobDole said and it works now.

Read full topic

item.title: A general 'fuck'
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I gave you the initial solution yesterday, man. When writing the size of the content pool, use an integer instead of byte…the size of the content pool is 256 bytes and a byte will write that as 0, whether you read it signed or unsigned since the greatest actual value of an unsigned byte is 255 (don’t forget zero, which makes 256 values).

Another possible error is that you’re trying to decompress loader.jar when you should be decompressing loader.nvk

Read full topic
